title: 114_hr4151
content: SECTION 1. LAND AND WATER CONSERVATION FUND. Reauthorization of the Land and Water Conservation Fund includes amending sections of the United States Code to remove specific timeframes and allocate funds for federal purposes and financial assistance to states. The Land and Water Conservation Fund reauthorization includes allocating funds for federal purposes such as the Forest Legacy Program, cooperative endangered species grants, and the American Battlefield Protection Program. Additionally, a minimum of 1.5 percent or $10,000,000 will be used for projects securing recreational public access to Federal land for hunting, fishing, or other recreational purposes. Conservation easements are also addressed in the amendments to the United States Code. The National Park Service Maintenance and Revitalization Conservation Fund is established in the Treasury with $150,000,000 deposited annually from revenues under the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act for critical maintenance and revitalization purposes. The National Park Service Maintenance and Revitalization Conservation Fund is established with annual deposits of $150,000,000 from Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act revenues. The Fund is to be used for high priority deferred maintenance needs of the National Park Service, supporting critical infrastructure and visitor services, without limitations on appropriations and excluding land acquisition.
